title: A Path to Universal Prosperity by 2100
content: Over the past century, economic growth has delivered higher incomes and longer lives, while empowering millions of people. Looking to the future, a world where everyone can live securely and with options – as opposed to just subsisting – is within reach, but will require emerging economies to continue expanding.
creator: Marc Canal Noguer
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Kevin Warsh’s Dangerous Monetary Nostalgia
content: The next US Federal Reserve chair seems to think that the large size of the central bank’s balance sheet reflects a discretionary policy choice which can and should be reversed. In reality, however, the Fed's balance sheet has become part of the financial system’s core infrastructure, and shrinking it would carry serious risks.
creator: Lucrezia Reichlin
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe Should Reject US-Style Competitiveness
content: European leaders seem increasingly convinced that, to succeed in the 21st century, they must reshape Europe's economy in America’s image. But the American brand of "competitiveness" contributes to major imbalances and far-reaching harm, which the European Union can avoid by embracing effective competition policy.
creator: Sandeep Vaheesan
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Will Democracy Govern Capitalism - or Be Consumed by It?
content: Following aggressive lobbying by the Trump administration, more than 145 countries agreed to give big US multinationals a free pass under the global corporate minimum tax rules that were agreed in 2021. But if democracy is to prevail over oligarchy, policymakers must tax extreme wealth appropriately – and they must do it fast.
creator: Joseph E. Stiglitz
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Democracy Dies in Broad Daylight
content: In America today, journalism still exists, but the chain that once ran from reporting to shared reality to institutional response has begun to break apart. The consequence is a democracy where truth no longer matters, because facts can be published, verified, and still fail to trigger a response.
creator: Carla Norrlöf
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump Is Destroying the Far-Right Brand
content: With its unparalleled global visibility, the United States offers an unavoidable case study of radical right-wing governance in action. Just as Brexit ultimately strengthened support for the European Union, MAGA-era America may serve as a cautionary example, weakening the appeal of authoritarianism in other democracies.
creator: Maciej Kisilowski
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Financial Gulf Stream Is Nearing a Tipping Point
content: For decades, the global economy rested on a financial arrangement that allowed the United States to borrow cheaply and absorb much of the world’s surplus output. But that system is beginning to come undone amid escalating geopolitical tensions and growing doubts about US policy stability.
creator: Giancarlo Corsetti
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump’s Iran Gamble
content: Although it is still possible that US President Donald Trump could accept a limited nuclear deal with Iran that allows him to declare victory, the more likely scenario is that he will try to repeat his recent success in Venezuela. There is just one problem: Iran is not Venezuela.
creator: Ian Bremmer
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump’s Failure of the Will
content: Donald Trump’s shock-and-awe approach to politics has often been compared to authoritarian and fascist leaders who have consolidated power through grand political spectacles. But these accounts conflate shock with genuine spectacle, which Trump is incapable of producing.
creator: J.P. Singh
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe Cannot Avoid an AI Reckoning
content: Given the risks it faces from all sides, Europe must move past its focus on regulatory excellence. Unless it makes rapid strides toward building the physical and financial infrastructure that a domestic European AI industry will need, such preoccupations will prove to be more of a liability than an asset.
creator: Soňa Muzikárová
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Super Bowl of Prediction Markets
content: As prediction markets have exploded onto the scene in recent years, allowing bets to be placed on a wide range of event-driven outcomes, many have asked whether it is optimal to have markets in everything. But the real question is how best to ensure that these powerful tools are transparent and auditable.
creator: Scott Duke Kominers
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Brother Trump
content: US President Donald Trump has demonstrated how quickly democratic politics can be overtaken by intimidation and cruelty. As Thomas Mann argued in the early 20th century, authoritarians gain power because they activate dispositions that already exist within democratic societies.
creator: Grzegorz Kwiatkowski
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Timing Africa’s Debt Restructuring
content: In 2025, sovereign-debt sustainability was largely a matter of luck. In 2026, governments and creditors must embrace a new framework for action on debt – one that identifies and addresses hidden debt issues before they spiral out of control, and delivers restructuring agreements fast enough to offer genuine relief.
creator: Vera Songwe
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump Is Not All Wrong About Mexico
content: Since intervening in Venezuela, US President Donald Trump has escalated his threats to use direct military action against Mexico’s drug cartels. But this would be ineffective, because curbing the cartels' power requires exposing their connections to the ruling Morena party.
creator: Guillermo Ortiz
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Biggest Mistake Warsh Could Make
content: Donald Trump's nominee for US Federal Reserve chair, Kevin Warsh, appears to be well qualified to respond effectively to the AI revolution. But his stated commitment to shrinking the Fed's bloated balance sheet could increase the risk of a bond market-induced financial crisis.
creator: Desmond Lachman
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump Is No Game Theorist
content: US President Donald Trump seems to think that he can impose high tariffs on other economies, such as China, without facing retaliation, thereby securing huge gains for the US. But as game theory – in particular, the prisoner's dilemma – shows, the more likely outcome is that both sides will end up worse off.
creator: Koichi Hamada
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: India’s Middle-Power Dilemma
content: Many hope that India will participate in a coalition of middle powers to uphold a rule-based international order. But it will take time for the country’s foreign-policy establishment to move away from “strategic autonomy” as a guiding principle, and recent US behavior has confirmed skeptics’ arguments that the West is unreliable.
creator: Ajay Shah
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: New World Order or Bust
content: With Donald Trump gleefully destroying what remains of the old postwar international order, the world is a mess. But the answer is not to defend institutions that have lost their effectiveness and legitimacy; it is to create something better, starting with AI, where we can build from the ground up.
creator: Margrethe Vestager
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Coming Crypto Apocalypse
content: The future of money and payments will feature gradual evolution, not the revolution that crypto-grifters promised. Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies’ latest plunge further underscores the highly volatile nature of this pseudo-asset class; one only hopes that policymakers will wake up to the risks before it’s too late.
creator: Nouriel Roubini
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Financialization Won’t Improve Global Health
content: Rather than address the weaknesses of the grant-based approach to global health financing, donors want to scrap it in favor of instruments that mobilize more private capital. But this new architecture distorts the risk landscape in ways that socialize losses, while privatizing profits and control.
creator: Walter O. Ochieng
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page
